alert.note: Alert for Coastal Del Norte; Del Norte Interior; Northern Humboldt Coast; Northern Humboldt Interior; Southern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 18 at 2:02PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...A line of strong showers will impact portions of northwestern Humboldt and Del Norte Counties through 245 PM... At 159 PM, Doppler radar was tracking heavy showers along a line extending from Bertsch-Oceanview to 27 miles west of Petrolia. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. Winds will shift from southerly to west or northwest as the line moves through. An isolated thunderstorm is possible. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Eureka, Arcata, Orick, Jedediah Smith State Park, Klamath, Trinidad, McKinleyville, Westhaven-Moonstone, Bertsch-Oceanview, Blue Lake, Myrtletown, Samoa, Arcata Arpt, Requa, Klamath Glen, Fieldbrook, Bayview, Cutten, Humboldt Hill and Pine Hills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
